com.pb.sawdust.util

Class ThreadTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.ThreadTimer

  • @ThreadSafe
public class ThreadTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    The ThreadTimer class is provides a convenient thread-specific timer. The timer is used to get arbitrary time durations. One ThreadTimer instance can be used across multiple threads, with each thread getting its own timer. More specifically, any call to this class' methods from a given thread will not affect any timer started/reset from a different thread.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ThreadTimer()
      Convenience constructor creating a ThreadTimer which reports durations in nanoseconds.
      ThreadTimer(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Constructor specifying the time unit to report durations recoreded by this class in.

      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit getTimeUnit()
      Get the time unit used in this timer.
      boolean isPaused()
      Determine whether the timer is currently paused (in the calling thread) or not.
      boolean isRunning()
      Determine whether the timer is currently running (in the calling thread) or not.
      long pauseTimer()
      Pause the timer and get the accumulated duration held by the timer.
      long pollTimer()
      Poll the timer to get the accumulated duration held by the timer.
      long resetTimer()
      Poll the timer to get the accumulated duration held by the timer, and reset the timer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadTimer

        public ThreadTimer(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Constructor specifying the time unit to report durations recoreded by this class in.
        Parameters:
        timeUnit - The time unit to report the durations in.

      • ThreadTimer

        public ThreadTimer()
        Convenience constructor creating a ThreadTimer which reports durations in nanoseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • startTimer

        public void startTimer()
        Start the timer. A timer may only be started if it has not been started yet, or if it has been stopped. A subsequent call (from the same thread) to pollTimer(), resetTimer() or endTimer will return the time duration from the time this method was called.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer (for the calling thread) is currently running.

      • endTimer

        public long endTimer()
        Stop the timer and get the accumulated duration held by the timer.
        Returns:
        the accumulated time duration held by the timer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer is not running.

      • resetTimer

        public long resetTimer()
        Poll the timer to get the accumulated duration held by the timer, and reset the timer. Resetting the timer means that subsequent calls (from this thread) to pollTimer(), resetTimer(), pauseTimer() or endTimer will return the time duration from the time this method was called.
        Returns:
        the accumulated time duration held by the timer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer is not running.

      • pauseTimer

        public long pauseTimer()
        Pause the timer and get the accumulated duration held by the timer. Subsequent calls to startTimer() will start the duration count from the accumulated duration returned by this function.
        Returns:
        the accumulated time duration held by the timer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer is not running or is paused.

      • pollTimer

        public long pollTimer()
        Poll the timer to get the accumulated duration held by the timer. This method will not reset the timer, so a subsequent call to pollTimer(), resetTimer(), pauseTimer(), or endTimer will return the time since this method was called plus the duration reported by this method.
        Returns:
        the accumulated time duration held by the timer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the timer is not running.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Determine whether the timer is currently running (in the calling thread) or not.
        Returns:
        true if the timer is currently running, false otherwise.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Determine whether the timer is currently paused (in the calling thread) or not.
        Returns:
        true if the timer is currently paused, false otherwise.

      • getTimeUnit

        public java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit getTimeUnit()
        Get the time unit used in this timer.
        Returns:
        this timer's time unit.
